abstract.p: With uncertain interest rates, the investment-timing option, which is the ability to postpone rather than immediately implement or reject a capital budgeting project, can significantly increase a project's value. Extant literature provides formulas for computing the value of rights to perpetually postponable projects and the hurdle rates for acceptance of such projects. This paper proposes a method for computing the value of an investment-timing option on a postponable project with a finite maturity. It estimates the gain in net present value by waiting to invest, and the incremental gain in net present value attributable to the embedded rights to postpone or reject a project, thereby providing a measure of the value of the investment-timing option. The effects of the time until expiration on hurdle rates and on the option to defer or reject the investment are also investigated.
